oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dickson-Williams Mansion, North Irish & West Church Streets, Greeneville, Greene, TN
Garden of Dickson-Williams Mansion. Greeneville, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1958 drawing from ca. 1850 daguerreotype, photo by Ray Moody

This is a photograph of what appears to be a charcoal drawing of a substantial two-story brick house with double chimneys on the gable ends. There is a formal garden with curving paths and trees in front of the house.
Confederate officer John Hunt Morgan spent a night at the Dickson-Williams Mansion before being discovered. He was killed as he tried to escape through the vineyard.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Gardens; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865; Generals--Confederate States of America
Holding Fast to Beauty
